chapter.htmlHeader: How should I switch from one antidepressant to another?
chapter.htmlStringContent:
• When switching from one antidepressant to another, be aware of the need for gradual and modest increases of dose, interactions between antidepressants, and the risk of serotonin syndrome when combinations of serotonergic antidepressants are prescribed. Features of serotonin syndrome include confusion, delirium, shivering, sweating, changes in blood pressure, and myoclonus.
    • Most severe cases of serotonin syndrome involve an MAOI (including moclobemide) and an SSRI.  
  • Abrupt withdrawal should generally be avoided when switching from one antidepressant to another. 
  • Cross tapering is usually preferred (an example of a cross-tapering regimen is shown in Table 1). However, in some instances it may be possible to withdraw the current antidepressant and start the new antidepressant on the next day, for example when switching from one serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) to another SSRI or a serotonin norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor (SNRI); the exception to this is fluoxetine.

    Table 1. An example of a cross-tapering regimen — switching from citalopram to mirtazapine.

     Pre-switch dosageWeek 1Week 2Week 3Week 4

subChapters.htmlHeader: Switching from a TCA to different TCA or to another type of antidepressant
subChapters.htmlStringContent:
• Cross-tapering with a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA) is inadvisable with paroxetine and fluvoxamine — if necessary it should be done very cautiously [SPS, 2019c].  
  • Clomipramine is a potent inhibitor of serotonin reuptake and serotonin syndrome is more likely if co-administered with an SSRI or SNRI — cross-tapering is not recommended except under specialist supervision [SPS, 2019c].  
    • Clomipramine should be withdrawn before starting a selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor (SSRI) or selective serotonin and noradrenaline reuptake inhibitor (SNRI) and vice versa.
  • Be aware that interactions with fluoxetine may still occur for 5 weeks after stopping fluoxetine because of its long half-life.

subChapters.htmlHeader: Switching from moclobemide to another antidepressant
subChapters.htmlStringContent:
• When switching from moclobemide to another antidepressant: 
    • Taper moclobemide then stop, then wait 24 hours before starting the other antidepressant.

[Taylor, 2018]
